column3:
Hmm... i'm not sure about this one (see below).
If one not uses labels, it looks uncommon.

![bildschirmfoto-2015-03-06-um-09 59 30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/6522666/b4533982-c3e7-11e4-9c04-27bb408fde36.png)
I'm not sure it makes sense to not use labels in the real world? You wouldn't be able to tell who paid you or for what... or for what you paid.\n
"Address" can be easily confused with bitcoin addresses, and it never displays a hostname. It does, however, display the service (port).\n

```
qt/bitcoingui.cpp:867:19: warning: ignoring return value of function declared with warn_unused_result attribute [-Wunused-result]
                  tr("Type: %1
").arg(type);
```
This reminds me of philosophy textbooks. Is there a simpler way to word "User-defined intent/purpose"?\n
What about `Destination label of the transaction`?\n
I imagine someone looking at the tooltip will be wondering _what_ a label is, so just repeating it won't really help.\n
"A user defined label for the destination of the transaction" ?\n
For received transactions, it generally describes the sender or purpose of payment.\n
